data.q: What is the main purpose of database transactions?
o: To group operations into a single unit of work
data.explanation: Transactions ensure that multiple operations are executed as a single atomic unit of work.

data.q: Which SQL command is used to permanently save changes made in a transaction?
data.explanation: The COMMIT command saves all changes made during the transaction.

data.q: Which SQL command is used to undo changes made in a transaction?
data.explanation: ROLLBACK undoes all changes made during the current transaction.

data.q: Which isolation level allows dirty reads?
data.explanation: READ UNCOMMITTED allows dirty reads, meaning uncommitted changes can be read.

data.q: Which isolation level prevents dirty reads but allows non-repeatable reads?
data.explanation: READ COMMITTED prevents dirty reads but does not prevent non-repeatable reads.

data.q: Which isolation level prevents both dirty reads and non-repeatable reads but allows phantom reads?
data.explanation: REPEATABLE READ prevents dirty and non-repeatable reads but phantom reads may still occur.

data.q: Which isolation level provides the strictest consistency guarantees?
data.explanation: SERIALIZABLE provides the highest isolation, ensuring transactions behave as if executed sequentially.

data.q: In Python's sqlite3 module, which method begins a transaction implicitly?
data.explanation: Executing any SQL statement implicitly begins a transaction unless autocommit mode is enabled.

data.q: Which phenomenon occurs when a transaction reads the same row twice and gets different values?
data.explanation: A non-repeatable read happens when a row is modified by another transaction between reads.

data.q: Which phenomenon occurs when new rows appear in a query result during repeated reads?
data.explanation: Phantom reads occur when new rows are inserted by another transaction during repeated queries.
